issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Steps:

1) log in to console and change password from <pasword1> to <password2>
2) log out and log in again with the new password <password2>
3) change password to <password3>

The change password dialog sets the "Current password" not to <password2> and attempt to change password (without manually entering current password) ends with error. Screenshot included,
fields.summary: When password is changed 2 times the "Current password" set in the dialog is not current

comments.body: [~dkavanagh] in the sentence you quoted I was trying to explain that after you changed the password one time the "Change password" dialog still remembers your old password as current. When I was changing  password for the second time, the auto-fill in the dialog was entering the wrong password in the "Current password" field, which I had to delete and manually type in the correct current password.

Ah, ok. I haven't seen this and I've tested with FF like you. I do see that the current password field is named "password" which could trigger a browser to fill it in, but without the username, I wouldn't expect that. I'll rename it "current_password" to see if that helps.

I have browser password save enabled on my browser and it does not pre-fill any of the fields on the change password form anymore. 

Changed password, logged out and back in three times and it worked every time! Yay!

verification done on mac osx 10.9.2, FF 27.0.1

I tested on FF28. I still see the "Current password" field pre-filled. When FF "Update password" prompt is answered with "Yes", then the pre-filled field uses correct value.  When FF "Update password" prompt is answered with "No", then it does not update to the changed password and the pre-filled field uses the old, incorrect value.  

[~jloza], is this behavior correct? Attaching movie when the "Update password prompt is answered with -No "
[~alice] no that definitely doesn't sound right. If password save is unchecked it shouldn't be pre-populating anything. Did you clear your cache in between? I didn't test this with PW save off.

[~jloza], I noticed later that there was a "Update password" request from FF in between pwd changes that I did not answer. This was the reason pre-populated password was not updated. Tested again, there is definitely a password being inputed in the "Current pwd" field of the change pwd dialog.

[~alice], I'm a little confused on this one. I'm trying to verify using FF. I think the behavior I am seeing is correct but according to your comment I may be incorrect.

Scenario 1:
* Change password
* Accept FF change password
* Log out and back in
* Change password again
* Current pw is auto-filled correctly w/ the last change

Scenario 2
* Change password
* *DO NOT* accept FF change password
* Log out and back in again (reject update pw suggestion again)
* Go to change password again
* Current pw is auto-filled incorrectly w/ the old password

I think this is correct because it's FF remembering the old one "for you". If you allow FF to update the password it works.

[~tony] Yes, I agree the console  pwd change behavior looks correct. I think we should approve fix.

 I am only confused by [~jloza]'s earlier comment: 
"I have browser password save enabled on my browser and it does not pre-fill any of the fields on the change password form anymore."

[~jloza], if the intended behavior for this dialog was to not pre-fill the "Current password" field, let's open a new ticket to fix this in 4.0.1.

[~tony] and [~alice] if it's pre-filling the current password correctly depending on whether you asked it to save the change or not (which it sounds like it is from [~tony]'s comment above, let's leave this behavior as-is. Pre-filling the current password is OK in this situation as long as it's not messing anything up.

Fix Verified.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucaconsole
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.1.0.442.20140522gite25b4597.el6

Correct password behavior is observed.
